meanings.definition: Make (an action or process) happen sooner or be accomplished more quickly.
meanings.sent1: To expedite the delivery, we will send it by express mail.
meanings.sent2: The manager expedited the approval process to meet the deadline.
meanings.sent3: Trying to expedite dinner by turning up the heat only burned the food.
meanings.sent4: Her quick thinking expedited the resolution of the problem.
meanings.sent5: The urgent call for help expedited the arrival of the ambulance.

meanings.definition: Process or dispatch (something, especially official business) with speed and efficiency.
meanings.sent1: The secretary will expedite the documents for immediate processing.
meanings.sent2: The post office expedited the passport application for the traveler.
meanings.sent3: The robot tried to expedite the paperwork but ended up mixing all the files.
meanings.sent4: The courier service expedited the delivery of the important package.
meanings.sent5: The efficient system in place expedited the handling of customer inquiries.
